name: P2P enthusiasm
description: Are they excited about the distributed web and are they publicly committed to making it happen?

beaker.details: Yes! _A peer-to-peer browser with tools to create and host websites. Don't just browse the Web, build it._ https://beakerbrowser.com

brave.details: One-click install of IPFS in production. Work in progress on native `ipfs://` URI backed by either a public gateway or embedded go-ipfs support: [brave-browser/issues/10220](https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/10220)

opera.details: *Opera for Android* supports IPFS with a native handler for `ipfs://` URI that redirects to the HTTP gateway of your choosing. Read more: [IPFS in Opera for Android](https://blog.ipfs.io/2020-03-30-ipfs-in-opera-for-android/).

firefox.details: Supportive, tracking APIs for p2p web applications in [bug 1435798](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1435798)

name: Native or programmable custom protocol handlers
description: Vendors who either support Distributed Web Schemes natively, or allow a browser extension to register itself as the handler for new protocols.

brave.details: Work in progress on `ipfs://` and `ipns://` URI backed by either a public gateway or embedded go-ipfs support: [brave-browser/issues/10220](https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/10220)

opera.details: *Opera for Android* supports IPFS with a native handler for `ipfs://` URI that redirects to the HTTP gateway of your choosing. Read more: [IPFS in Opera for Android](https://blog.ipfs.io/2020-03-30-ipfs-in-opera-for-android/).

chrome.details: *Chrome 86* [safelisted](https://blog.chromium.org/2020/09/chrome-86-improved-focus-highlighting.html) Distributed Web Schemes for redirect-based `registerProtocolHandler()`; [Protocol Labs](https://protocol.ai/) and [Igalia](https://igalia.com) work on improving protocol handler APIs in Chromium for both Web and WebExtension contexts.

edge.details: Supportive, looking into protocol handlers as part of their PWA work

firefox.details:
Supportive: [bug #1271553](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271553)
Prototyping API as a part of [libdweb](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb): [Protocol handler API](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb/issues/2)

name: Origin Isolation and Secure Context
description: Correctly implement Origin isolation for DWeb URIs, or allow WebExtensions to control how Origin-based security context is defined.

brave.details: Work in progress on native `ipfs://` URI: [brave-browser/issues/10220](https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/10220)

opera.details: *Opera for Android* provides native `ipfs://` and `ipns://` with subdomain gateways for Origin isolation

name: WebRTC issues
description: Committed to fixing WebRTC bugs and performance issues

name: Local Discovery
description: Allow a WebExtension to do DNS-based Service Discovery API as per [RFC6763](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6763).

firefox.details: Supportive, prototyping API as a part of [libdweb](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb): [DNS-SD API](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb/issues/7)

name: TCP/UDP Sockets
description: Allow a WebExtension to act as a client and server socket APIs for TCP or UDP networking.

firefox.details:
Supportive: [bug #1247628](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1247628)
Prototyping API as a part of [libdweb](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb): [UDP Socket](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb/issues/4), [TCP Socket](https://github.com/mozilla/libdweb/issues/5). On the other hand, [negative position](https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/431#event-3756882378) regarding raw sockets in regular Web API.

name: DNS lookup
description: Allow JS implementations and/or WebExtensions to query DNS for `A`/`AAAA`/`TXT`/`SRV` records.

firefox.details:
Support for `A`/`AAAA` lookups via [`browser.dns.resolve` API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/dns/resolve) ([bug 1373640](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1373640)).
Missing `SRV` ([bug 14328](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14328)) and `TXT` ([bug 1449171](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1449171)).
